qas.question: What fraction of the population of North Carolina was enslaved in 1860?
North Carolina did not vote to join the confederacy until they were ordered to invade what state?
When was North Carolinas official secession?
When did Tennessee officially vote to secede?

context: In 1860, North Carolina was a slave state, in which <a0_0>one-third<a0_0/> of the population was enslaved. This was a smaller proportion than in many Southern states. The state did not vote to join the Confederacy until President Abraham Lincoln called on it to invade its sister state, <a1_0>South Carolina<a1_0/>, becoming the last or second-to-last state to officially join the Confederacy. The title of "last to join the Confederacy" has been disputed; although Tennessee's informal secession on <a3_0>May 7, 1861<a3_0/>, preceded North Carolina's official secession on <a2_0>May 20<a2_0/>, the Tennessee legislature did not formally vote to secede until <a4_0>June 8, 1861<a4_0/>.
